name: The Fairmont Washington DC

reviews.text: I'm a Platinum member of Fairmont President's club, their highest level. But I can say that the service here isn't what I expected. The bellmen at the front didn't even ask if they could help me get my bags out of my car. They just let me get them myself then held the front door open.
reviews.title: Service not what I expected and check your bill

reviews.text: On checkout, I realized that i had been billed $16 for a 2 minute call to an adjacent state which I thought was a toll free number. The front desk attendant acted like he was doing me a big favor by dropping it down to half. Then when I reviewed my credit card statement, a few days later, the hotel had charged me for mini bar items when I never even opened it. This is the third time in a row I've been charged for refreshments I never consumed at this hotel. Nothing big here, but I expect more from a $400 per night Fairmont property.
reviews.title: Not worth the rack rate

reviews.text: Here's the deal on this hotel. It feels like luxury but that is really based on the lobby, courtyard, and people. Wonderful staff that are helpful and friendly are a huge plus at the Fairmont DC. The location is good but definitely a bit of a walk to the monuments (I went on a great morning run from the hotel along the river and around the monuments, highly recommend something like that!). The room was worn. Big tube tv, older look to the linens and furniture. That was fine for the rate that I paid (I got a bargain at 180 I think) but the standard rate of $400 is too much for things to be outdated. I also had really poor service at the restaurant--friendly but I was forgotten about. It was an honest mistake and the server was incredibly apologetic after I finally got her attention 20 minutes later. All in all I enjoyed my stay but probably wouldn't have had I paid the full rate.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Could not say enough good things about my stay. The bed was very comfortable, linens were soft and top quality. The personal assistants were very helpful, informative and friendly. Service was top notch, rooms were amazing, Food was excellent. I highly recommend this hotel if you are big in receiving the best service your money could buy. I found myself in one of the most enjoyable and stunning hotels in DC. Thank you everyone for making my stay so pleasant. I strong recommend this hotel and I 'm planning to go back for the summer.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fernanda
reviews.title: Nice
My favorite hotel in DC
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Fairmont many times over the years. Our most recent visit was in August. The hotel is located in Georgetown, it's location convenient to the University and to the fine shops and restaurants of the area.
While the hotel is not new, it is quietly elegant. The rooms are large and well furnished with quality, serviceable interiors. The bathroom was also spacious. The service is impeccable.
reviews.title: Superb service and well kept hotel

reviews.text: The rates fluctuate dramatically based on Congressional and diplomatic activity. On our most recent visit in August, the room was $160/night, a real bargain.. In October, the same room was $469. On another occasion, in March, rooms were totally unavailable and we ended up staying at a very unsatisfactory hotel (another story) for $500/night. I suggest becoming a member of their President's Club, which gives one some priority in obtaining room reservations, a free newspaper, and other benefits. I also suggest reserving well in advance.
reviews.title: Mediocre Front Desk/Acctg Service (great Concierge: Kitt V.)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I look forward to staying at the Fairmont frequently over the next four years. It is truly a quality institution.
reviews.title: Excellent choice

reviews.text: Stayed one night here for a business meeting - it is truly a well kept, classy hotel. Definitely for the elegant traveler. Rooms are very comfortable and large, staff was incredibly friendly, and the restaurant (Juniper) was great. Beautiful courtyard to relax in too. Location is a bit outside of Georgetown but I'd still recommend this place.
reviews.title: The Perfect Convention Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a beautiful room at a very convinient location. We did not use any of the facilities, so can not comment on them. Note: valet parking is $40 (fourty bucks) per day, which is a shame. You should be able to find plenty of free parking on a same block :) High Speed Internet did not work in our room.
reviews.title: Plush/Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stopped here to break up our trip from Columbus to Williamsburg for my sister's wedding. It's been a long time either of us have been so impressed by a hotel - or travels have left us jaded and setting standards perhaps a bit too high, but the Fairmont met them all. From pulling up Wednesday afternoon to driving off Thursday morning, the service was impeccable. Everyone on the staff was well-trained, efficient, friendly and courteous. Not once was anyone condescending, rude, or distant. The room was beautiful (warm earth tones with asian accents) and spotless. We unfortunately had no chance to use our free access to the health club, or to try out their new restaurant, but can hopefully try them out on our next visit to DC, as the Fairmont will definitely be our first choice.
reviews.title: Unsurpassed Service
Very disappointed
reviews.text: I made reservations at the this hotel and cancelled them 2 days later decided to stay at another hotel just because of location, wanted to be in downtown DC not in Georgetown. I cancelled the reservations 2 days after I booked it well low and behold I got my bill today and they charged me for a 1 night stay saying I was a no show. Called and spoke with Tashi in the account depatment and because I didn't have my cancellation number she couldn't refund me. I told her again the situation and explained that because someone in your company didn't do their job correctly I now have to pay $266.00. I also kindly asked if they would be willing to maybe split it with me and she said no. I will never stay at this hotel nor will I recommend this hotel to anyone but I will let everyone I can know my situation. They have the worst customer service around and I am so glad I chose to stay at the Marriott Metro Center they were wonderful, the location was great, much cheaper for a top notched hotel!!!!! (Although I had to put a date of stay on this report I DID NOT STAY HERE!!!!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price-we reserved the King Suite which included breakfast and snacks, I hate to say it but it was mediocre.
reviews.title: Mediocre

reviews.text: The room we had was a little oddly shaped with a long hallway like area. It was sort of like a u-shape with the closet in the middle. It was dimly lit maybe for the ambience but it kinda made it feel dingy, if that makes sense. It was clean but the decor and dim lights made it feel uncomfortable? The beds were comfortable and high off the ground. My husband really loved the fact that they gave him business cards with his name and hotel name and phone. And the cool thing was that they greeted you with your name.
reviews.title: Overpriced and mediocre
Excellent Location - Stay on Gold Floor
reviews.text: This Fairmont is perfectly situated between downtown and Georgetown, with an easy walk to the White House. We stayed on the Gold Floor -- worth every penny. The rooms are nicer and you receive complimentary food and beverage service throughout the day. The spa/gym is not luxurious. If you are seeking that type of atmosphere, you would be better off at the Four Seasons or the Ritz Carlton. The staff is remarkable -- kind and helpful.

This is a lovely, first-rate hotel. However, it lacks the charm, location and history that other top hotels in DC have (for example, the Willard). The Fairmont is also in a rather sterile location in DC. It is surrounded by office buildings, and there really is not much in the immediate vicinity. Since I travel to DC for business (and do not have to pay the bill), I would not stay in the Fairmont again. There are a number of other, better options in DC. I was pleased to learn, however, that the Fairmont does allow pets, with no non-refundable pet deposit or extra fees. The breakfast was good, but nothing dramatic. It was definitely not worth the $28 per person fee for the buffet. I preferred the Ritz Carlton in DC (despite its similarly poor location).
reviews.title: There are better hotels in DC.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three nights at the Fairmont Washington on their Gold Floor. We were thoroughly pampered by very attentive staff who took care of our every need. The hotel itself is very beautiful and has excellent facilities, including health club and pool, courtyard bar and restaurant, and a stunning lobby lounge. I would sincerely recommend the Gold experience and look forward to returning for our next stay.
reviews.title: A fabulous experience

reviews.text: We booked this hotel late, having stayed in the Fairmont in new york and thoroughly enjoyed it. We informed the hotel of the fact that we had a RV with us and we would require parking. Before booking they were very saying there are several near by and that something could be organized. They re-assured us so we went ahead and booked. They Said speak to the receptionist on at the time of our arrival and they will give us further information.
reviews.title: 5 star hotel, with the qualities of a 3 star

reviews.text: Arrived at the hotel and the receptionist blanked us. We informed him that we dont mind traveling and again was little help.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay

reviews.text: My family goes every year Chrstmas week. We have always stayed the same room "712". I travel all over for business and pleasure and this hotel is a JEM !. I can't say enough about the quality of service and level of detail.. Rooms , healthclub, lobby are all 5 star. Location is best in the city. Every staff member went way out of their way to make sure that my family had a great time. I will be back next year. I am sure that they will gladly give us 712 again
reviews.title: The Best of the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During 2010 my wife and I spent ten nights in this lovely oasis. The Fairmont has the largest, most comfortable lobby and outdoor center courtyard/dining area of any urban hotel we have stayed in. The staff is exceptionally competent and professional, the rooms are large and well appointed and the location is ideal. The West End area is an upscale, interesting mix of condos, townhouses, hotels and corporations. An easy stroll to Foggy Bottom, GWU, Georgetown or Dupont Circle. Enjoy a room on a high floor overlooking M or 24th Street. Avoid the view of the WWF headquarters.
reviews.title: My favorite hotel in any major city.

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Fairmont Georgetown on (3) different occasions. It's location just 2 blocks to the heart of Georgetown shops & restaurants, and 3 blocks to Foggy Bottom Metro stop is top-notch! This is a very upscale hotel with fantastic service, yet doesn't feel stuffy or formal. The rooms are spacious, clean and very comfortable (love the beds!); the concierge very helpful; and the breakfast buffet is wonderful!
reviews.title: Great location & perfect service!

reviews.text: We liked being able to walk into Georgetown for shopping & dinner, and the proximity of the Metro stop made it extremely easy to get to the monuments and Washington Reagan airport.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, but Isolated from the Main Attractions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can often get a nightly rate that includes buffet breakfast for 2 and parking. I think this is a 5-star hotel at 3-star prices.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great rates and Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Fairmont for 4 nights as part of our Honeymoon to the USA. We loved the location as it is so central to all the attractions from Georgetown to the Capital Building.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel in a Great Location

reviews.text: The staff are all very courteous and helpful. Check in was a breeze and the rooms are very spacious and clean. Nothing was a problem for the concierge or any of the staff.
reviews.title: Elegance in the Capital

reviews.text: We would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Nation's Capital.
reviews.title: This historic hotel has some pleasant surprises

reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised by a lovely bottle of Champagne and congratulations note upon check in. It is these little touches that make a difference between a good hotel and a great hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but they need to upgrade the service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all we had nothing to fault and would definately recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: simply the best
Excellent hotel
reviews.text: This is a very comfortable luxury hotel with top grade staff who, uniformly, appear to be pleased you chose their hotel. We stayed on two consecutive weekends and the quality was identical. Rooms are spacious and well appointed - although we were advised that floors 7 & 8 on which we stayed were newly refurbished so other floors may vary.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is good in that it is a 25 minute walk, 5-10 minute taxi to White House/Capitol/Smithsonian in one direction and a 10 minute stroll in the other to the restaurants of Georgetown. Plentiful taxis available outside the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thoroughly recommend the Fairmont.
reviews.title: Perfect location, pleasant and helpful staff

reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel. It was my first time in Washington and I definitely chose the right hotel. From the doormen to the room service staff everyone was so friendly and willing to help it made the stay extremely pleasurable. The hotel itself is quite luxurious, however, there was no snobbish atmosphere you sometimes experience in this class of hotel. The hotel is right on Georgetown's doorstep and not far from the metro which allows you to get to all of the major sightseeing locations fairly quickly. If we return to Washington I will definitely be staying at the Fairmont again.
reviews.title: Just Lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the Fairmont after careful review of many comments in Tripadvisor. The Hotel was easy to find and the experience at Reception was of efficiency. We were offered an upgrade to the 'Gold' floor for $100 on our first night and $150 for the other 2 nights. This allowed us the use of a dedicated recption area and a superb quality Continental breakfast. This is served in an exclusive Lounge area dedicated to the Gold floor. Various little snacks provided during the day with complimentary soft drinks. Alcoholic drinks are based on an 'honesty' system. Wines on offer were of excellent quality and a fair price. The staff on duty on the Gold floor can only be described as superb. They are friendly and attentive. Be aware that all the bedding (pillows and duvet) are feather based. I am allergic to feathers but my request to swap to non-allergenic fillings was met within minutes - very good service. Hotel is well positioned for travel within DC and only a few minutes walk to Georgetown. Whilst this Hotel is rated in the luxury class, the staff are down to earth and there are no snobbish dress codes etc. It's simply quietly luxurious which leads to a calm atmosphere. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great hotel, tremendous location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Almost two years since a previous stay at the Fairmont and the hotel remains a great destination. Excellent staff throughout and comfortable, quiet, well serviced rooms. Handy for the restaurants and bars of Georgetown (a 15 minute stroll) but a 10 minute taxi ride to central, downtown Washington.
reviews.title: Still excellent

reviews.text: The central open air courtyard is a very pleasant lunch area in summer. I would thoroughly recommend the Fairmont for a quality stay in Washington.
reviews.title: Comfortable, elegant and excellent service

reviews.text: Great classic hotel, centrally located. As you would expect, the rooms, facilities and decor are first rate, but the service really stands out. Within five minutes from rolling up at the entrance, I was in my room. Even after the restaurant closes at 10:30pm you can get some late night snacks in the lounge. I would recommend enrolling in the President's Club. It is a great loyalty rewards program and you get upgrades and perks, such as free internet.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a Great Location

reviews.text: We traveled to Washington with our two kids (ages 15 and 11), along with our friends and their two kids (same ages). We researched the hotels in Washington and choose the Fairmont. We definetly made the right choice! The hotel is in a perfect location and is beautiful. We stayed in the Ambassador Suite, which was perfect for a family of four. We did have a problem with the location of our rooms, however this was resloved immediately by Keith, the hotel manager. The hotel concierge, Rob, helped us with tickets to the sights, he also made reservations at some great restraunts for all of us. Breakfast was aslo included in our rate - a very big buffet and or cooked to order meal. Traveling around the city was very easty from the hotel, the metro is a short walk. Also, Georgetown right down the street from the hotel. We loved the Fairmont and will retrurn!
reviews.title: Perfectly Good Business Hotel in Wash DC

reviews.text: Perfectly good business hotel in wash dc. Lobby could be less suburban, but other than that, not much to quibble with.
reviews.title: Nice hotel; needs more food/dining options

aka: The Fairmont Washington Dc Hotel Washington Dc
description: A sunlit urban oasis that soothes the spirit, the Fairmont Washington, D.C., Georgetown is authentically local from its airy "bringing the outside in" design by renowned architect Vlastimil Koubek, to its celebrated cuisine by Juniper Chef Ian Bens and resident beekeeper who is continually creating seasonal and innovative dishes using ingredients from nearby farms.Our luxury Washington, D.C. hotel offers 415 spacious guest rooms and suites that will provide you with a welcome retreat. Try a relaxing visit to our hotel’s large health club and indoor pool or sit outside with your laptop or book in our serene courtyard garden. Whether here for business or your annual family vacation, we understand that your visit to Washington is important. During this important time, our goal is to help create wonderful memories for you.
